info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 4 at 6:08PM EDT until May 4 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 608 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Gables, Kendall, The Redland, Pinecrest, Zoo Miami, Richmond West, West Perrine, Richmond Heights, Goulds, Country Walk, Princeton, The Crossings, Cutler Bay, Palmetto Bay, The Hammocks, South Miami Heights, Three Lakes, Palmetto Estates, Howard and Inlikita. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING
